SENT.plain: With the development of penicillin, Streptococcus pneumoniae has become an uncommon cause of bacterial endocarditis in adults
Subacute manifestation of pneumococcal endocarditis has been reported a few times in the literature, but most reports define the disease as acute, severe, and having a high mortality rate
We report the case of a 58-year-old male with subacute bacterial endocarditis due to Streptococcus pneumoniae
We stress the low frequency of this agent as a cause of endocarditis and the atypical evolution of this case
The pathophysiology, clinical manifestations and evolution, and the therapeutical options for this type of infection are also discussed
